property.name: settings
property.value:
{ "title": " ",
"description": "Fit the odpm and plot it with residuals ",
"type": 1,
"animate": false,
"intervalrefresh": false,
"legendpos": 2,
"stack": false,
"orientation": 1,
"bgcolor": "#010102", 
"scale": 1,
"SERIES": [
{ "name": "Model ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # raw data to fit with, just first 2hr:sl:n mmp <- head(meanmax(POWER),7200);:sl:n secs <- seq(1,length(mmp),1);:sl:n multiuniq(mmp,secs);:sl:n:sl:n # fit starting values, then LM fit the ODPM model to first hours:sl:n cp <- 200; W<-11000; pmax <- 1000; a<-40;:sl:n fit <- lm( W:sl:/x*(1-exp(-x:sl:/(W:sl:/(pmax-cp)))) + cp - a*(log(x:sl:/1800))*(bool(x>1800)), secs, mmp);:sl:n:sl:n # success, generate prediction data:sl:n if (fit[0] <> 0) { :sl:n annotate(label, :qu:CP:qu:, round(cp));:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:W':qu:, round(W));:sl:n :sl:n:sl:n yy <- sapply(secs, W:sl:/x*(1-exp(-x:sl:/(W:sl:/(pmax-cp)))) + cp - a*(log(x:sl:/1800))*(bool(x>1800))); :sl:n:sl:n ## time to exhaustion at 300w:sl:n lbyy <-yy; lbsecs<-secs; multisort(ascend, lbyy,lbsecs);:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:TTE:qu:, round(lbsecs[lowerbound(lbyy,cp)]:sl:/6):sl:/10);:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { secs; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 2, "color": "#010117", "opacity": 1, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "Bests ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # raw data to fit with, just first 2hr:sl:n mmp <- head(meanmax(POWER),7200);:sl:n secs <- seq(1,length(mmp),1);:sl:n multiuniq(mmp,secs);:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { secs; }:sl:n y { mmp; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 3, "symbol": 0, "size": 2, "color": "#010112", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": false, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false} ]
,
"AXES": [
{ "name": "seconds ", "type": 0, "orientation": 1, "align": 1, "minx": 1, "maxx": 7200, "miny": 0, "maxy": 0, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": true, "log": true, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#2684f6", "axiscolor": "#2684f6"},
{ "name": "watts ", "type": 0, "orientation": 2, "align": 1, "minx": 0, "maxx": 0, "miny": 0, "maxy": 950, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": true, "log": false, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#010117", "axiscolor": "#010117"} ]
}

property.name: settings
property.value:
{ "title": " ",
"description": "Peronnet Thibault Model, WKO4 Model is basically an unattributed rip-off ",
"type": 1,
"animate": false,
"intervalrefresh": false,
"legendpos": 2,
"stack": false,
"orientation": 1,
"bgcolor": "#010102", 
"scale": 1,
"SERIES": [
{ "name": "Model ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # raw data to fit with, just first 2hr:sl:n mmp <- head(meanmax(POWER),10000);:sl:n secs <- seq(1,length(mmp),1);:sl:n multiuniq(mmp,secs);:sl:n:sl:n # fit starting values:sl:n ftp <- 200; frc<-11000; pmax <- 1000; a<-40;:sl:n tau2<-50; tte<-1800;:sl:n:sl:n fit <- lm((frc:sl:/x*(1-exp(-x:sl:/(frc:sl:/pmax)))) + ((ftp*(1-exp(-x:sl:/tau2))) - (bool(x>tte)*(a*log(x:sl:/tte)))), secs,mmp);:sl:n:sl:n # success, generate prediction data:sl:n if (fit[0] <> 0) { :sl:n annotate(label, :qu:Pmax:qu:, round(pmax));:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:FTP:qu:, round(ftp));:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:FRC:qu:, round(frc));:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:TTE:qu:, round(tte)); :sl:n :sl:n # cache the paramters so we can use them:sl:n store(:qu:ftp:qu:,ftp);:sl:n store(:qu:frc:qu:,frc);:sl:n store(:qu:pmax:qu:,pmax);:sl:n store(:qu:tte:qu:,tte);:sl:n store(:qu:a:qu:,a);:sl:n store(:qu:tau2:qu:,tau2);:sl:n store(:qu:secs:qu:, secs);:sl:n:sl:n # generate the model curve:sl:n yy <- sapply(secs, (frc:sl:/x*(1-exp(-x:sl:/(frc:sl:/pmax)))) + ((ftp*(1-exp(-x:sl:/tau2))) - (bool(x>tte)*(a*log(x:sl:/tte))))); :sl:n:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { round(secs); }:sl:n y { round(yy); }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 2, "color": "#ff0004", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "Bests ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # raw data to fit with, just first 20 minutes:sl:n mmp <- head(meanmax(POWER),10000);:sl:n secs <- seq(1,length(mmp),1);:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { round(secs); }:sl:n y { round(mmp); }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 3, "symbol": 0, "size": 3, "color": "#ffa71a", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": false, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "pFRC ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # cache the paramters so we can use them:sl:n ftp <- fetch(:qu:ftp:qu:);:sl:n frc <- fetch(:qu:frc:qu:);:sl:n pmax<- fetch(:qu:pmax:qu:);:sl:n tte<- fetch(:qu:tte:qu:);:sl:n a<- fetch(:qu:a:qu:);:sl:n tau2<- fetch(:qu:tau2:qu:);:sl:n secs<- fetch(:qu:secs:qu:);:sl:n:sl:n # generate the model curve:sl:n yy <- sapply(secs, frc:sl:/x*(1-exp(-x:sl:/(frc:sl:/pmax)))); :sl:n:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { round(secs); }:sl:n y { round(yy); }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 2, "color": "#113dff", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": false, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "pFTP ", "group": " ", "xname": "seconds ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # cache the paramters so we can use them:sl:n ftp <- fetch(:qu:ftp:qu:);:sl:n frc <- fetch(:qu:frc:qu:);:sl:n pmax<- fetch(:qu:pmax:qu:);:sl:n tte<- fetch(:qu:tte:qu:);:sl:n a<- fetch(:qu:a:qu:);:sl:n tau2<- fetch(:qu:tau2:qu:);:sl:n secs<- fetch(:qu:secs:qu:);:sl:n:sl:n # generate the model curve:sl:n yy <- sapply(secs, ((ftp*(1-exp(-x:sl:/tau2))) - (bool(x>tte)*(a*log(x:sl:/tte))))); :sl:n:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { round(secs); }:sl:n y { round(yy); }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 2, "color": "#4bc045", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false} ]
,
"AXES": [
{ "name": "seconds ", "type": 0, "orientation": 1, "align": 1, "minx": 1, "maxx": 10000, "miny": 0, "maxy": 0, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": true, "log": true, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#2684f6", "axiscolor": "#2684f6"},
{ "name": "watts ", "type": 0, "orientation": 2, "align": 1, "minx": 0, "maxx": 0, "miny": 0, "maxy": 950, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": true, "log": false, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#ff0004", "axiscolor": "#ff0004"} ]
}

property.name: script
property.value:
## R (Daimon) -> Python (Fe)
##.....................................................
##.....................................................
##
## R-chart script.
## Chart: SS-SR
## Creator: Daimon
##
## For use with GoldenCheetah.
## tested on GC.version() is "DEV-V3.5 1705"
##
## .................................................
##
## Tri Mix
## Last Edited At: 2017-09-26 - Creator: Daimon
## Triathlon
## Chart to display the relation between Swim-Bike-Run in the selected Data Range as
## function of activities / duration / distance.

## Default graph is pie chart.
## (in script "pie=TRUE" displays pie charts, "pie=FALSE" displays bar graph)

## Remark:
## if the triathlon sports are not defined as the default English "Swim","Bike","Run" then change the names accoordingly in the script "sportlist=c("Swim","Bike","Run")"
## 
##.....................................................
##
## Python script
## Chart: Py_tri_mix_01 (cover R tri mix)
## Creator: Fe 
##
## GC.version() "V3.6-RC1" (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
##
## 08'2022
## Python Script 
##
## Python1: pre-installed (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
## Plotly1: pre-installed (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
##
## Python2: 3.7.9 (Aug 17 2020)
## Plotly2: 4.6.0 --> 5.2.1
##
## Golden Cheetah: "V3.6-RC1" (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
## Trends
##
##.....................................................


## packages
import numpy as np
import plotly as ply
import datetime
import tempfile
import pathlib
from plotly import tools
import plotly.graph_objs as go

#......................................................

temp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w+t", prefix="GC_", suffix=".html", delete=False)

#......................................................

pie=True## False

sportlist=["Swim","Bike","Run"]

color=['rgb(87,140,181)','rgb(255, 153, 0)','rgb(133,166,122)']
#'rgb(255,214,77)'

header1='Activities' #"
header2='Duration (h:mm:ss)'
header3='Distance (km)'
header4='Normalized effort (%)' ##???
paper_bgcolor='rgb(20,20,20)'
plot_bgcolor='rgb(20,20,20)'

metrics=GC.seasonMetrics(all=False, filter='', compare=False)
trg=[];time=[];distance=[]

for sport_name in sportlist:
 filter=np.array(metrics['Sport'])==[sport_name]
 trg.append(len(np.array(metrics['Duration'])[filter]))
 time.append(np.sum(np.array(metrics['Duration'])[filter]))
 distance.append(np.sum(np.array(metrics['Distance'])[filter]))


## trg=[50,70,35] ## random values, only for plot jpg
## time=[70000,158529,45000] ## random values, only for plot jpg
## distance=[100,1000,450] ## random values, only for plot jpg


def hms(seconds):
 h = int(seconds // 3600)
 m = int(seconds % 3600 // 60)
 s = int(seconds % 3600 % 60)
 return '{:02d}:{:02d}:{:02d}'.format(h, m, s)

time_hms=[hms(sec) for sec in time]

trace=[];layout=[]

if pie:
 trace1 = dict(
 values=trg,
 marker=dict(colors=color),labels=sportlist,textfont=dict(size=13,color='white'),
 type='pie',
 hoverinfo='label+percent',textinfo='value+label',textposition='outside',
 #domain=dict(column=0,row=0),
 domain=dict(x=[0,0.49],y=[0.55,1])
 )
 trace.append(trace1)

 trace2 = dict(
 values=time,
 marker=dict(colors=color),labels=sportlist,textfont=dict(size=13,color='white'),
 type='pie',
 text=time_hms,#[hms(sec) for sec in time],
 hoverinfo='percent+label',textinfo='text+label',textposition='outside',
 #domain=dict(column=1,row=0),
 domain=dict(x=[0.51,1.0],y=[0.55,1])
 )
 trace.append(trace2)

 trace3 = dict(
 values=np.round(distance,2),
 marker=dict(colors=color),labels=sportlist,textfont=dict(size=13,color='white'),
 type='pie',
 hoverinfo='label+percent',textinfo='value+label',textposition='outside',
 #domain=dict(column=0,row=1)
 domain=dict(x=[0,0.49],y=[0,0.45])
 )
 trace.append(trace3)

 grid_data=[[0.25,1.05,header1,'orange'],[0.8,1.05,header2,'orange'],[0.25,0.5,header3,'orange'],[0.8,0.4,'Sport','lightgreen']]

 grid_title=[dict(x=a,y=b,text=c,showarrow=False,xanchor='center',font=dict(color=d,size=15)) for a,b,c,d in grid_data]

 layout=dict(title='Tri mix',titlefont=dict(size=18,color='rgb(243,218,11)'),paper_bgcolor=paper_bgcolor,plot_bgcolor=plot_bgcolor,grid=dict(rows=2,columns=2),#columns=2),
 legend=dict(x=0.8,y=0.25,xanchor="center",font=dict(color='white')),
 annotations=grid_title
 )

else:

 trace1 = dict(
 x=sportlist,y=trg,
 name=header1,
 text=trg,marker=dict(color=color),textfont=dict(size=14,color='white'),
 type='bar',
 xaxis='x1',yaxis='y1',
 )
 trace.append(trace1)

 trace2 = dict(
 x=sportlist,y=time,
 name=header2,
 text=time_hms,marker=dict(color=color),textfont=dict(size=14,color='white'),
 type='bar',
 xaxis='x2',yaxis='y2',
 )
 trace.append(trace2)

 trace3 = dict(
 x=sportlist,y=np.round(distance,2),
 name=header3,
 text=np.round(distance,2),marker=dict(color=color),textfont=dict(size=14,color='white'),
 type='bar',
 xaxis='x3',yaxis='y3',
 )
 trace.append(trace3)

 trace4 = dict(
 x=[0,1],y=[0,1],mode="lines",line=dict(color=plot_bgcolor),
 xaxis='x4',yaxis='y4',
 )
 trace.append(trace4)


 axis=dict(
 showline=False,zeroline=False,showgrid=False,mirror=False,tickfont=dict(size=11,color='lightgrey'))
 
 grid_data=[[len(trg)/3,max(trg)*1.08,header1,'orange','x1','y1'],[len(time)/3,max(time)*1.08,header2,'orange','x2','y2'],[len(distance)/3,max(distance)*1.08,header3,'orange','x3','y3']]#,[1/2,1/2,'Sport','lightgreen','x4','y4']]

 grid_title=[dict(x=a,y=b,text=c,xref=e,yref=f,showarrow=False,font=dict(color=d,size=14)) for a,b,c,d,e,f in grid_data]

 grid_data_4=[[1/2,1/1.2,'Sport :','white','x4','y4',17,'left'],[1/2,1/1.4,'- '+str(sportlist[0]),color[0],'x4','y4',15,'left'],[1/2,1/1.6,'- '+str(sportlist[1]),color[1],'x4','y4',15,'left'],[1/2,1/1.9,'- '+str(sportlist[2]),color[2],'x4','y4',15,'left']]

 grid_title_4=[dict(x=a,y=b,text=c,xref=e,yref=f,showarrow=False,font=dict(color=d,size=g),xanchor=h) for a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h in grid_data_4]
 

 layout=dict(
 title='Tri mix',titlefont=dict(size=18,color='rgb(243,218,11)'),
 paper_bgcolor=paper_bgcolor,plot_bgcolor=plot_bgcolor,bargap=0,showlegend=False,
 xaxis1=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.0,0.45], anchor='y1')),
 xaxis2=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.55, 1.0], anchor='y2')),
 xaxis3=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.0, 0.45],anchor='y3')),
 xaxis4=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.55, 1.0],anchor='y4',showticklabels=False)), 
 yaxis1=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.55, 1.0], anchor='x1',showticklabels=False)),
 yaxis2=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.55,1.0], anchor='x2',showticklabels=False)),
 yaxis3=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.0, 0.45], anchor='x3',showticklabels=False)),
 yaxis4=dict(axis,**dict(domain=[0.0, 0.45], anchor='x4',showticklabels=False)),
 #legend=dict(x=0.8,y=0.15,xanchor="center",font=dict(color='white')),
 annotations=grid_title+grid_title_4
 )



fig = dict(data=trace, layout=layout)

ply.offline.plot(fig,auto_open = False, filename=temp_file.name, validate=False)

GC.webpage(pathlib.Path(temp_file.name).as_uri())

property.name: script
property.value:
##
## Python program will run on selection.
##

## This chart plots 7-day moving averages against a 
# band of "normal values" derived by taking the 60-day
# moving average and subtracting (for the floor) and 
# adding (for the ceiling) 0.75 standard devations to 
# it. 
#
# Currently this chart uses HRV4Training recovery points.
# 
# If you want to use rMSSD values instead, make sure you
# apply a natural log as per recommendation in this forum
# post:
# 
# https://forum.trainerroad.com/t/anyone-using-hrv-heart-rate-variability/5664/188?u=cyclhist
#
# For the science behind this plot, see: 
#
# https://www.hrv4training.com/blog/training-prescription-guided-by-heart-rate-variability
#
# Thanks to Marco Altini for his work and help!

## BEGINNING OF CONFIGURATION

# The baseline is a moving average of the following 
# number of days

BASELINE_DAYS=7

# The band for the normal range is calculates as a 
# moving average of the following number of days 
# +/- 0.75 standard deviations.

NORMALRANGE_DAYS=60 

# The following variable determines the Training Stress 
# metric. This could be BikeStress, or TSS, or your own
# metric that tries to compensate for missing power data
# with HR data somehow. I use BikeStress here. If you use
# Duration, the plot will chart hours rather than the 
# seconds in the dataset. In that case, you might want 
# to adjust the range on the second yaxis in the code 
# below.

TRAINING_STRESS="TriScore"

## END OF CONFIGURATION 

import os
import tempfile
import pandas as pd
import plotly
from plotly.graph_objs import Scatter, Layout, Bar, Figure

## Delete old chart
try:
 os.remove(tempfile.gettempdir() + "/temp-plot.html")
except:
 pass

## Let's get dates and recovery points
measuresHistoryWithZeros = pd.DataFrame(GC.seasonMeasures(all = True, group="Hrv"))[["date", "RECOVERY_POINTS"]]

measuresSelectionWithZeros = pd.DataFrame(GC.seasonMeasures(all = False, group="Hrv"))[["date", "RECOVERY_POINTS"]]

# Remove zero values
measuresHistory = measuresHistoryWithZeros.query("RECOVERY_POINTS != 0.0")
measuresSelection = measuresSelectionWithZeros.query("RECOVERY_POINTS != 0.0")

# Get training data
rawTrainingData = pd.DataFrame(GC.seasonMetrics())[['date', TRAINING_STRESS]]

# Convert TSS to number

trainingDataSeries = rawTrainingData.groupby('date')[TRAINING_STRESS].sum()
trainingData = pd.DataFrame({'date': trainingDataSeries.index, TRAINING_STRESS: trainingDataSeries.values})

# Create new columns
measuresHistory['Baseline'] = measuresHistory['RECOVERY_POINTS'].rolling(window=BASELINE_DAYS, min_periods=4).mean()
measuresHistory['NormalRange'] = measuresHistory['RECOVERY_POINTS'].rolling(window=NORMALRANGE_DAYS, min_periods=20).mean()
measuresHistory['StandardDeviation'] = measuresHistory['RECOVERY_POINTS'].rolling(window=NORMALRANGE_DAYS, min_periods=20).std()
measuresHistory['Ceiling'] = measuresHistory['NormalRange'] + (0.75 * measuresHistory['StandardDeviation'])
measuresHistory['Bottom'] = measuresHistory['NormalRange'] - (0.75 * measuresHistory['StandardDeviation'])

# Apply Selection
hrvData = measuresHistory[measuresHistory['date'].isin(measuresSelection['date'])]

# Add Training Data
allData = hrvData.join(trainingData.set_index('date'), on='date', how='right')


# Create plots

if TRAINING_STRESS == "Duration":

 trace0 = Bar(
 x = allData['date'],
 y = (allData[TRAINING_STRESS] / 60) / 60,
 yaxis = "y2",
 name = "Duration [h]",
 marker = dict(
 color = "#1f77b4"
 )
 )

else:

 trace0 = Bar(
 x = allData['date'],
 y = allData[TRAINING_STRESS],
 yaxis = "y2",
 name = TRAINING_STRESS,
 marker = dict(
 color = "#1f77b4"
 )
 )


trace1 = Scatter(
 x=hrvData['date'],
 y=hrvData['Ceiling'],
 fill= None,
 mode='lines',
 name="Top Normal",
 line=dict(
 color='#b3f6d1',
 )
)
trace2 = Scatter(
 x=hrvData['date'],
 y=hrvData['Bottom'],
 fill='tonexty',
 mode='lines',
 name="Bottom Normal",
 line=dict(
 color='#b3f6d1',
 )
)

trace3 = Scatter(
 x=hrvData['date'],
 y=hrvData['Baseline'],
 mode='lines',
 name="Baseline",
 line=dict(
 color='red',
 )
)


trace4 = Scatter(
 x=hrvData['date'],
 y=hrvData['RECOVERY_POINTS'],
 mode='lines+markers',
 name="Recovery Points",
 line=dict(
 color='black',
 )
)


data = [trace0, trace1, trace2, trace3, trace4]

if TRAINING_STRESS == "Duration":
 layout = Layout(
 yaxis = dict(
 title = "HRV Recovery Points",
 range = [4,10]
 ),
 yaxis2 = dict(
 title = "Duration [h]",
 overlaying = "y",
 side = "right",
 range = [0,10]
 ),
 legend = dict(
 orientation = "h"
 )
 )

else:
 layout = Layout(
 yaxis = dict(
 title = "HRV Recovery Points",
 range = [4,10]
 ),
 yaxis2 = dict(
 title = "Training Stress",
 overlaying = "y",
 side = "right",
 range = [0,800]
 ),
 legend = dict(
 orientation = "h"
 )
 )

fig = Figure(data = data, layout = layout)

## Prepare Plot
f =plotly.offline.plot(fig, auto_open = False, filename = tempfile.gettempdir() + "/temp-plot.html")

## Load Plot
GC.webpage("file://" + f)

{ "name": "NEEE ", "group": " ", "xname": "Date ", "yname": "kCal ", "program": "{:sl:n finalise {:sl:n xx <- measures(:qu:Body:qu:, :qu:date:qu:);:sl:n:sl:n # Mifflin St Jeor equation for BMR:sl:n m <- measures(:qu:Body:qu:, :qu:WEIGHTKG:qu:); # mass(kg):sl:n h <- config(height); # height(m):sl:n age <- (xx-config(dob)):sl:/365; # age(y):sl:n s <- config(sex)=:qu:Male:qu: ? 5 : -161;#sex(kCal):sl:n bmr <- 10*m + 625*h - 5*age + s;:sl:n:sl:n # Activity Factor (excluding Excercise):sl:n actFactor <- 1.2; # Mostly sedentary:sl:n:sl:n # Non-Exercise Energy Expenditure:sl:n yy <- round(bmr*actFactor);:sl:n:sl:n avg <- mean(yy);:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:Avg NonEx:qu:, round(avg));:sl:n }:sl:n x { xx; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 0, "color": "#d58ed5", "opacity": 1, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "ExEE ", "group": " ", "xname": "Date ", "yname": "kCal ", "program": "{:sl:n finalise {:sl:n xx <- measures(:qu:Body:qu:, :qu:date:qu:);:sl:n:sl:n # Exercise Energy Expenditure:sl:n # Aggregate for multiple sessions on a day:sl:n exee <- aggregate(metrics(Calories), metrics(date), sum);:sl:n exdd <- aggregate(metrics(date), metrics(date), mean);:sl:n # Add 0s on rest days (not found on exdd):sl:n yy <- round(sapply(xx, exdd[lowerbound(exdd, x)]=x ? exee[lowerbound(exdd,x)] : 0));:sl:n:sl:n avg <- mean(yy);:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:Avg Exercise:qu:, round(avg));:sl:n }:sl:n x { xx; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n} ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 0, "color": "#40bf5d", "opacity": 1, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
{ "name": "Expend ", "group": " ", "xname": "Date ", "yname": "kCal ", "program": "{:sl:n finalise {:sl:n xx <- curve(NEEE, x);:sl:n yy <- curve(NEEE, y) + curve(ExEE, y);:sl:n avg <- mean(yy);:sl:n annotate(label, :qu:Avg Expend:qu:, round(avg));:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { xx; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 0, "color": "#ff0000", "opacity": 1, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 1, "fill": false},
